**Overview**

Change your Microsoft 365 password to keep your account secure

**Issue**

**[Watch a video](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RWe8JR?pid=ocpVideo0-innerdiv-oneplayer&postJsllMsg=true&maskLevel=20&market=en-us) **about how to change your Microsoft 365 password or follow the instructions below.

### **Steps**

1\. Sign in to [office.com/signin](http://office.com/signin) with your work account.

2\. Go to Settings > Password.

3\. Enter your old password.

4\. Create a new password and confirm it.

5\. Select Submit to finish and change your password.

**Troubleshooting**

If you still have troubles changing your password please contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com) below.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

## Readiness Course Resources

The TeamDynamix Readiness Course is designed to empower organizations to hit the ground running when the implementation starts by providing many of the basic TeamDynamix configuration points in a digestible format. Below are common, useful resources for TDX Admins who are just getting started with configuration or are enrolled in Readiness.

  1. [TDX Solutions - Readiness Course KBs](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1965/Portal/KB/?CategoryID=20782)
Knowledge about the Readiness Course itself and the content within the course.
  2. [ITSM Tool Feature Crosswalk ](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1965/Portal/KB/ArticleDet?ID=156033)
A feature cross-walk to help new TDX admins with experience in other ITSM tools to help begin to grasp those concepts in TeamDynamix.
  3. [Pros and Cons of Multiple Ticketing, Asset, and Client Portal Apps ](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1965/Portal/KB/ArticleDet?ID=121350)
A comparison of single- or multi-app TDX environments to help with Enterprise Service Management decision-making.
  4. [10 Important Decisions For Your ITSM Implementation](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1965/Portal/KB/ArticleDet?ID=157356&SIDs=12543)
A list of critical decision points for your implementation to help prepare ahead of time.

**Overview**

Follow these instructions to update the Zoom Desktop Application.

**Issue**

  1. Log into the Zoom App on your desktop.
  2. Click on your **profile  **in the top right corner.
  3. Select **Check for Updates**.
  4. The latest version of Zoom will start to download. Once it is complete, click **Download**.

**Troubleshooting**

If you should continue to have issues, please restart your computer.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

You may setup Office 365 email on your iPhone, iPad or iPod Touch.

**Issue**

  1. On your iOS device, open the App Store and search for Microsoft Outlook
  2. Tap the Get button
  3. Once the app is installed tap the Open button
  4. You will be prompted to set up a new account
  5. Enter your email address
  6. Tap Add Account
  7. You will be presented with the 2FA prompt
  8. Enter the password for your Computer User ID and tap Sign in
  9. You will be taken to your Inbox where you can configure the Outlook app
  10. If you want Outlook to be your default mail app open the Settings app and navigate to:
     1. Outlook
     2. Default Mail App
     3. Choose Outlook

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues setting up your email please ensure to turn your device off and turn it back on.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

You may be expecting a message on your office phone while away from your desk for an extended period of time. You can access your voicemail from any phone remotely.

**Issue**

**In Office:**

  1. Dial **80**  or **5200** , then *****  and the four digit extension of the mailbox (e.g. *1234).
  2. Enter the passcode for the mailbox.
  3. Press **7**  to play messages.
  4. Press **3**  to delete messages.

**Remote:**

  1. Dial **604-323-5200  **and follow instructions.

**Troubleshooting**

Please ensure to use the correct dial in information from above to access your voicemail.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you are noticing that your PDF documents are automatically loading into your web browser you may be experiencing a limited number of feature.  A few options you will loose are: **Can 't sign a document, can't leave comments and can't open fillable PDF forms**. The solution is to change your default PDF reader to Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

**Issue**

First thing is to make sure of is that you already have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed on your computer. If you don't then by just installing it the issue will automatically be resolved.  If you need it installed on a corporate computer you will need to enter a Service Request Ticket.

To check if you have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed

  * Click the **Search**  icon beside the Start button
  * Type **Adobe**. If it's installed you will see it in the list.

There are a number of different ways to make this change but we will only look at one of them.

  * Click the **Search  **icon beside the start button again
  * Type **Default Apps**

  * Click**  Default Apps** to open it
  * Scroll down until you see **Set defaults by app  **and click it
  * You will now see a list of installed programs
    * **Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

  * Click **Manage**  on the next screen
  * You should now see a screen similar to this

  * More then likely your Default App for .pdf is your web browser (In this case mine is set to Microsoft Edge)
  * To make the change
    * Click **Microsoft Edge**
    * Then click **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

From now one, whenever you open a PDF document through a link, it will open in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC with all the functionality.

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues please make sure that Adobe is installed on your computer.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

There are a number of ways to report an issue in the Client Portal. When you request services through our Service Catalog, your request is automatically routed to the relevant team so we can get right to work.

**Issue**

  1. Navigate to the Client Portal at [https://solutions.teamdynamix.com](https://buffalony.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1850/Portal/Home/)
  2. In the top right corner, click Sign In
  3. In the top left of the Client Portal home page, click the Report an Issue button
  4. From the list of incident types, click the name of the service that most closely resembles your issue
  5. Click the button to the right of the page labelled Request Service.
     * If prompted, sign in using your account credentials.
  6. Fill out the form, providing as much detail as possible
     * Note that required fields have an asterisk (*) next to them
  7. At the bottom of the form, click Request

Note: It is highly recommended that you use a specific service page to request assistance, as using the generic Report an Issue service page may result in longer delays.

**Troubleshooting**

If you should have troubles signing in, please use this link [Click Here](http://solutions.teamdynamix.com) to submit a public service which does not require authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you receive a spam message you should send the message to [spam@teamdynamix.com](mailto:spam@access.ironport.com?subject=I%20would%20like%20to%20report%20spam%20or%20phishing%20to%20IT) as an attachment. Sending the message as an attached file is **crucial**  so necessary Internet headers are included. You must send the message from the inbox of the original recipient.

To report a phishing message, follow the procedure for reporting spam.

**Issue**

## What is spam?

Spam is unsolicited junk email sent indiscriminately in bulk, often for commercial purposes. Much of it is sent by botnets, networks of virus-infected computers, complicating the process of tracking down the spammers. According to various estimates, about 80% of all email in the world may be spam.

## What is phishing?

Phishing is the practice of defrauding users into giving up their usernames, passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal information. Phishing emails will often try to get you to click on links that take you to fake websites. They often pretend to be from organizations such as a bank, PayPal, Amazon, or even TeamDynamix.

Never respond to email asking you to provide personal information. TDX will never ask you for personal information by email.

## Steps on forwarding an email as an attachment for several popular email clients and web browsers

### Microsoft Outlook (Windows)

_Highlight the message_ , press Ctrl + Alt + F \--or-- _Highlight or Open  the message_, on the "Home" tab under the "More" option
of the "Respond" group choose Forward as attachment \--or-- _Open a new message,  _ drag and drop the message(s) to be forwarded into the
body of the new message.

###

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , drag and drop message(s) into the new message window

###

---

### Microsoft Outlook (Mac)

_Highlight the message_ , Control+Command+J  ( ^⌘J )

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _ on the **home ribbon  **click on **attachment**

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _on the **Message  **menu select **attachment**

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , **drag and drop  **message(s) into the **new message window**

### Mac OS X Mail

_Highlight message_ , select **Forward as Attachment  **from the menu

Further troubleshooting advice will be provided once the spam or phishing email is received.

**Overview**

Remote access to the organizations network is available by connecting your device to Cisco's AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Service. Click on the appropriate link below for installation steps. Once installed, login with your userID and password.

NOTE: You must be granted permission to use remote VPN software. Please complete the [VPN Access Request Form](https://teamdynamix.com).

Check with your departmental technical support staff for assistance with setting up your computer so that it is configured correctly for remote access.

**Issue**

## Installation steps

If you have Java installed on your computer you will be prompted to manually download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client. To ensure proper installation of the AnyConnect client, please uninstall any earlier Cisco VPN clients, restart your computer and then install the new client.

## Connection steps

  1. Launch the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.
  2. Verify that **evpn2.sample.com**  is in the _**Connect to:**_  field.
  3. Click **Connect**
  4. Login with your User**ID  **and password and click **OK**.Disconnection steps
  5. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).

## Disconnection steps

  1. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).
  2. Click **Disconnect**.

**Troubleshooting**

Be sure to uninstall earlier VPN version and reboot before installing Cisco AnyConnect client.

If you experience problems logging in after your VPN request has been approved, reset your userD password then try logging in to VPN again.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Up to now you only had a password to protect your account. If someone got hold of your password (an authentication factor), this person could use your username and password to impersonate you. If the system would request a second or third unique factor, taking over your account is a lot harder. There are 3 factors of authentication:

  1. Something you **know** : your password
  2. Something you **have** : your (smart)phone
  3. Something you **are** : your fingerprint

As you can see, with MFA just stealing your password will not be enough to take control of your account.

**Issue**

Microsoft 365 is currently using Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), relying on a password and a phone. In short it can be explained in the following steps:

  1. Your Office 365 account gets enabled for MFA
  2. Next time you logon to an Microsoft 365 account you need to configure MFA (this requires a web browser)
  3. You identify the methods of the second authentication. If you have an iPhone or Android we recommend the **Authenticator App**  (see screenshot of the app on an iPhone)
  4. After you complete configuration, MFA will be invoked each time you connect to an Microsoft 365 service from a new device.

**Troubleshooting**

If you have a smartphone, we recommend using the **Microsoft Authenticator App**. It makes using Microsoft 365 MFA quick and easy. Install it ahead of time from the:

  * [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-authenticator/id983156458?mt=8)
  * [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.azure.authenticator&hl=en_US)

Also, when you use your fingerprint to unlock the smartphone, you are truly using 3-factor authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you are noticing that your PDF documents are automatically loading into your web browser you may be experiencing a limited number of feature.  A few options you will loose are: **Can 't sign a document, can't leave comments and can't open fillable PDF forms**. The solution is to change your default PDF reader to Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

**Issue**

First thing is to make sure of is that you already have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed on your computer. If you don't then by just installing it the issue will automatically be resolved.  If you need it installed on a corporate computer you will need to enter a Service Request Ticket.

To check if you have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed

  * Click the **Search**  icon beside the Start button
  * Type **Adobe**. If it's installed you will see it in the list.

There are a number of different ways to make this change but we will only look at one of them.

  * Click the **Search  **icon beside the start button again
  * Type **Default Apps**

  * Click**  Default Apps** to open it
  * Scroll down until you see **Set defaults by app  **and click it
  * You will now see a list of installed programs
    * **Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

  * Click **Manage**  on the next screen
  * You should now see a screen similar to this

  * More then likely your Default App for .pdf is your web browser (In this case mine is set to Microsoft Edge)
  * To make the change
    * Click **Microsoft Edge**
    * Then click **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

From now one, whenever you open a PDF document through a link, it will open in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC with all the functionality.

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues please make sure that Adobe is installed on your computer.

**Overview**

If you receive a spam message you should send the message to [spam@teamdynamix.com](mailto:spam@access.ironport.com?subject=I%20would%20like%20to%20report%20spam%20or%20phishing%20to%20IT) as an attachment. Sending the message as an attached file is **crucial**  so necessary Internet headers are included. You must send the message from the inbox of the original recipient.

To report a phishing message, follow the procedure for reporting spam.

**Issue**

## What is spam?

Spam is unsolicited junk email sent indiscriminately in bulk, often for commercial purposes. Much of it is sent by botnets, networks of virus-infected computers, complicating the process of tracking down the spammers. According to various estimates, about 80% of all email in the world may be spam.

## What is phishing?

Phishing is the practice of defrauding users into giving up their usernames, passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal information. Phishing emails will often try to get you to click on links that take you to fake websites. They often pretend to be from organizations such as a bank, PayPal, Amazon, or even TeamDynamix.

Never respond to email asking you to provide personal information. TDX will never ask you for personal information by email.

**Overview**

Remote access to the organizations network is available by connecting your device to Cisco's AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Service. Click on the appropriate link below for installation steps. Once installed, login with your userID and password.

NOTE: You must be granted permission to use remote VPN software. Please complete the [VPN Access Request Form](https://teamdynamix.com).

Check with your departmental technical support staff for assistance with setting up your computer so that it is configured correctly for remote access.

**Issue**

## Installation steps

If you have Java installed on your computer you will be prompted to manually download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client. To ensure proper installation of the AnyConnect client, please uninstall any earlier Cisco VPN clients, restart your computer and then install the new client.

## Connection steps

  1. Launch the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.
  2. Verify that **evpn2.sample.com**  is in the _**Connect to:**_  field.
  3. Click **Connect**
  4. Login with your User**ID  **and password and click **OK**.Disconnection steps
  5. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).

## Disconnection steps

  1. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).
  2. Click **Disconnect**.

**Troubleshooting**

Be sure to uninstall earlier VPN version and reboot before installing Cisco AnyConnect client.

If you experience problems logging in after your VPN request has been approved, reset your userD password then try logging in to VPN again.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Up to now you only had a password to protect your account. If someone got hold of your password (an authentication factor), this person could use your username and password to impersonate you. If the system would request a second or third unique factor, taking over your account is a lot harder. There are 3 factors of authentication:

  1. Something you **know** : your password
  2. Something you **have** : your (smart)phone
  3. Something you **are** : your fingerprint

As you can see, with MFA just stealing your password will not be enough to take control of your account.

**Issue**

Microsoft 365 is currently using Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), relying on a password and a phone. In short it can be explained in the following steps:

  1. Your Office 365 account gets enabled for MFA
  2. Next time you logon to an Microsoft 365 account you need to configure MFA (this requires a web browser)
  3. You identify the methods of the second authentication. If you have an iPhone or Android we recommend the **Authenticator App**  (see screenshot of the app on an iPhone)
  4. After you complete configuration, MFA will be invoked each time you connect to an Microsoft 365 service from a new device.

**Troubleshooting**

If you have a smartphone, we recommend using the **Microsoft Authenticator App**. It makes using Microsoft 365 MFA quick and easy. Install it ahead of time from the:

  * [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-authenticator/id983156458?mt=8)
  * [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.azure.authenticator&hl=en_US)

Also, when you use your fingerprint to unlock the smartphone, you are truly using 3-factor authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Change your Microsoft 365 password to keep your account secure

**Issue**

**[Watch a video](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RWe8JR?pid=ocpVideo0-innerdiv-oneplayer&postJsllMsg=true&maskLevel=20&market=en-us) **about how to change your Microsoft 365 password or follow the instructions below.

### **Steps**

1\. Sign in to [office.com/signin](http://office.com/signin) with your work account.

2\. Go to Settings > Password.

3\. Enter your old password.

4\. Create a new password and confirm it.

5\. Select Submit to finish and change your password.

## Installation steps

If you have Java installed on your computer you will be prompted to manually download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client. To ensure proper installation of the AnyConnect client, please uninstall any earlier Cisco VPN clients, restart your computer and then install the new client.

## Connection steps

  1. Launch the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.
  2. Verify that **evpn2.sample.com**  is in the _**Connect to:**_  field.
  3. Click **Connect**
  4. Login with your User**ID  **and password and click **OK**.Disconnection steps
  5. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).

## Disconnection steps

  1. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).
  2. Click **Disconnect**.

**Troubleshooting**

Be sure to uninstall earlier VPN version and reboot before installing Cisco AnyConnect client.

If you experience problems logging in after your VPN request has been approved, reset your userD password then try logging in to VPN again.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Up to now you only had a password to protect your account. If someone got hold of your password (an authentication factor), this person could use your username and password to impersonate you. If the system would request a second or third unique factor, taking over your account is a lot harder. There are 3 factors of authentication:

  1. Something you **know** : your password
  2. Something you **have** : your (smart)phone
  3. Something you **are** : your fingerprint

As you can see, with MFA just stealing your password will not be enough to take control of your account.

**Issue**

Microsoft 365 is currently using Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), relying on a password and a phone. In short it can be explained in the following steps:

  1. Your Office 365 account gets enabled for MFA
  2. Next time you logon to an Microsoft 365 account you need to configure MFA (this requires a web browser)
  3. You identify the methods of the second authentication. If you have an iPhone or Android we recommend the **Authenticator App**  (see screenshot of the app on an iPhone)
  4. After you complete configuration, MFA will be invoked each time you connect to an Microsoft 365 service from a new device.

**Troubleshooting**

If you have a smartphone, we recommend using the **Microsoft Authenticator App**. It makes using Microsoft 365 MFA quick and easy. Install it ahead of time from the:

  * [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-authenticator/id983156458?mt=8)
  * [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.azure.authenticator&hl=en_US)

Also, when you use your fingerprint to unlock the smartphone, you are truly using 3-factor authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you are noticing that your PDF documents are automatically loading into your web browser you may be experiencing a limited number of feature.  A few options you will loose are: **Can 't sign a document, can't leave comments and can't open fillable PDF forms**. The solution is to change your default PDF reader to Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

**Issue**

First thing is to make sure of is that you already have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed on your computer. If you don't then by just installing it the issue will automatically be resolved.  If you need it installed on a corporate computer you will need to enter a Service Request Ticket.

To check if you have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed

  * Click the **Search**  icon beside the Start button
  * Type **Adobe**. If it's installed you will see it in the list.

There are a number of different ways to make this change but we will only look at one of them.

  * Click the **Search  **icon beside the start button again
  * Type **Default Apps**

  * Click**  Default Apps** to open it
  * Scroll down until you see **Set defaults by app  **and click it
  * You will now see a list of installed programs
    * **Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

  * Click **Manage**  on the next screen
  * You should now see a screen similar to this

  * More then likely your Default App for .pdf is your web browser (In this case mine is set to Microsoft Edge)
  * To make the change
    * Click **Microsoft Edge**
    * Then click **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

From now one, whenever you open a PDF document through a link, it will open in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC with all the functionality.

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues please make sure that Adobe is installed on your computer.

**Overview**

If you receive a spam message you should send the message to [spam@teamdynamix.com](mailto:spam@access.ironport.com?subject=I%20would%20like%20to%20report%20spam%20or%20phishing%20to%20IT) as an attachment. Sending the message as an attached file is **crucial**  so necessary Internet headers are included. You must send the message from the inbox of the original recipient.

To report a phishing message, follow the procedure for reporting spam.

**Issue**

## What is spam?

Spam is unsolicited junk email sent indiscriminately in bulk, often for commercial purposes. Much of it is sent by botnets, networks of virus-infected computers, complicating the process of tracking down the spammers. According to various estimates, about 80% of all email in the world may be spam.

## What is phishing?

Phishing is the practice of defrauding users into giving up their usernames, passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal information. Phishing emails will often try to get you to click on links that take you to fake websites. They often pretend to be from organizations such as a bank, PayPal, Amazon, or even TeamDynamix.

Never respond to email asking you to provide personal information. TDX will never ask you for personal information by email.

  1. On your iOS device, open the App Store and search for Microsoft Outlook
  2. Tap the Get button
  3. Once the app is installed tap the Open button
  4. You will be prompted to set up a new account
  5. Enter your email address
  6. Tap Add Account
  7. You will be presented with the 2FA prompt
  8. Enter the password for your Computer User ID and tap Sign in
  9. You will be taken to your Inbox where you can configure the Outlook app

If you continue to have issues setting up your email please ensure to turn your device off and turn it back on.

**Overview**

**Issue**

**In Office:**

  1. Dial **80**  or **5200** , then *****  and the four digit extension of the mailbox (e.g. *1234).
  2. Enter the passcode for the mailbox.

  4. Press **3**  to delete messages.

**Remote:**

Please ensure to use the correct dial in information from above to access your voicemail.

**Overview**

If you are noticing that your PDF documents are automatically loading into your web browser you may be experiencing a limited number of feature.  A few options you will loose are: **Can 't sign a document, can't leave comments and can't open fillable PDF forms**. The solution is to change your default PDF reader to Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

**Issue**

First thing is to make sure of is that you already have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed on your computer. If you don't then by just installing it the issue will automatically be resolved.  If you need it installed on a corporate computer you will need to enter a Service Request Ticket.

To check if you have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed

  * Click the **Search**  icon beside the Start button
  * Type **Adobe**. If it's installed you will see it in the list.

There are a number of different ways to make this change but we will only look at one of them.

  * Click the **Search  **icon beside the start button again
  * Type **Default Apps**

  * Click**  Default Apps** to open it
  * Scroll down until you see **Set defaults by app  **and click it
  * You will now see a list of installed programs
    * **Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

  * Click **Manage**  on the next screen
  * You should now see a screen similar to this

  * More then likely your Default App for .pdf is your web browser (In this case mine is set to Microsoft Edge)
  * To make the change
    * Click **Microsoft Edge**
    * Then click **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

From now one, whenever you open a PDF document through a link, it will open in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC with all the functionality.

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues please make sure that Adobe is installed on your computer.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you receive a spam message you should send the message to [spam@teamdynamix.com](mailto:spam@access.ironport.com?subject=I%20would%20like%20to%20report%20spam%20or%20phishing%20to%20IT) as an attachment. Sending the message as an attached file is **crucial**  so necessary Internet headers are included. You must send the message from the inbox of the original recipient.

To report a phishing message, follow the procedure for reporting spam.

**Issue**

## What is spam?

Spam is unsolicited junk email sent indiscriminately in bulk, often for commercial purposes. Much of it is sent by botnets, networks of virus-infected computers, complicating the process of tracking down the spammers. According to various estimates, about 80% of all email in the world may be spam.

## What is phishing?

Phishing is the practice of defrauding users into giving up their usernames, passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal information. Phishing emails will often try to get you to click on links that take you to fake websites. They often pretend to be from organizations such as a bank, PayPal, Amazon, or even TeamDynamix.

Never respond to email asking you to provide personal information. TDX will never ask you for personal information by email.

of the "Respond" group choose Forward as attachment \--or-- _Open a new message,  _ drag and drop the message(s) to be forwarded into the
body of the new message.

###

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , drag and drop message(s) into the new message window

###

---

### Microsoft Outlook (Mac)

_Highlight the message_ , Control+Command+J  ( ^⌘J )

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _ on the **home ribbon  **click on **attachment**

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _on the **Message  **menu select **attachment**

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , **drag and drop  **message(s) into the **new message window**

### Mac OS X Mail

_Highlight message_ , select **Forward as Attachment  **from the menu

**Overview**

Remote access to the organizations network is available by connecting your device to Cisco's AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Service. Click on the appropriate link below for installation steps. Once installed, login with your userID and password.

NOTE: You must be granted permission to use remote VPN software. Please complete the [VPN Access Request Form](https://teamdynamix.com).

Check with your departmental technical support staff for assistance with setting up your computer so that it is configured correctly for remote access.

**Issue**

## Installation steps

If you have Java installed on your computer you will be prompted to manually download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client. To ensure proper installation of the AnyConnect client, please uninstall any earlier Cisco VPN clients, restart your computer and then install the new client.

## Connection steps

  1. Launch the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.
  2. Verify that **evpn2.sample.com**  is in the _**Connect to:**_  field.
  3. Click **Connect**
  4. Login with your User**ID  **and password and click **OK**.Disconnection steps
  5. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).

## Disconnection steps

  1. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).
  2. Click **Disconnect**.

**Troubleshooting**

Be sure to uninstall earlier VPN version and reboot before installing Cisco AnyConnect client.

If you experience problems logging in after your VPN request has been approved, reset your userD password then try logging in to VPN again.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Up to now you only had a password to protect your account. If someone got hold of your password (an authentication factor), this person could use your username and password to impersonate you. If the system would request a second or third unique factor, taking over your account is a lot harder. There are 3 factors of authentication:

  1. Something you **know** : your password
  2. Something you **have** : your (smart)phone
  3. Something you **are** : your fingerprint

As you can see, with MFA just stealing your password will not be enough to take control of your account.

**Issue**

Microsoft 365 is currently using Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), relying on a password and a phone. In short it can be explained in the following steps:

  1. Your Office 365 account gets enabled for MFA
  2. Next time you logon to an Microsoft 365 account you need to configure MFA (this requires a web browser)
  3. You identify the methods of the second authentication. If you have an iPhone or Android we recommend the **Authenticator App**  (see screenshot of the app on an iPhone)
  4. After you complete configuration, MFA will be invoked each time you connect to an Microsoft 365 service from a new device.

**Troubleshooting**

If you have a smartphone, we recommend using the **Microsoft Authenticator App**. It makes using Microsoft 365 MFA quick and easy. Install it ahead of time from the:

  * [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-authenticator/id983156458?mt=8)
  * [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.azure.authenticator&hl=en_US)

Also, when you use your fingerprint to unlock the smartphone, you are truly using 3-factor authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Change your Microsoft 365 password to keep your account secure

**Issue**

**[Watch a video](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RWe8JR?pid=ocpVideo0-innerdiv-oneplayer&postJsllMsg=true&maskLevel=20&market=en-us) **about how to change your Microsoft 365 password or follow the instructions below.

### **Steps**

1\. Sign in to [office.com/signin](http://office.com/signin) with your work account.

2\. Go to Settings > Password.

3\. Enter your old password.

4\. Create a new password and confirm it.

5\. Select Submit to finish and change your password.

**Troubleshooting**

If you still have troubles changing your password please contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com) below.

Check with your departmental technical support staff for assistance with setting up your computer so that it is configured correctly for remote access.

**Issue**

## Installation steps

If you have Java installed on your computer you will be prompted to manually download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client. To ensure proper installation of the AnyConnect client, please uninstall any earlier Cisco VPN clients, restart your computer and then install the new client.

## Connection steps

  1. Launch the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.
  2. Verify that **evpn2.sample.com**  is in the _**Connect to:**_  field.
  3. Click **Connect**
  4. Login with your User**ID  **and password and click **OK**.Disconnection steps
  5. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).

## Disconnection steps

  1. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).
  2. Click **Disconnect**.

**Troubleshooting**

Be sure to uninstall earlier VPN version and reboot before installing Cisco AnyConnect client.

If you experience problems logging in after your VPN request has been approved, reset your userD password then try logging in to VPN again.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Up to now you only had a password to protect your account. If someone got hold of your password (an authentication factor), this person could use your username and password to impersonate you. If the system would request a second or third unique factor, taking over your account is a lot harder. There are 3 factors of authentication:

  1. Something you **know** : your password
  2. Something you **have** : your (smart)phone
  3. Something you **are** : your fingerprint

As you can see, with MFA just stealing your password will not be enough to take control of your account.

**Issue**

Microsoft 365 is currently using Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), relying on a password and a phone. In short it can be explained in the following steps:

  1. Your Office 365 account gets enabled for MFA
  2. Next time you logon to an Microsoft 365 account you need to configure MFA (this requires a web browser)
  3. You identify the methods of the second authentication. If you have an iPhone or Android we recommend the **Authenticator App**  (see screenshot of the app on an iPhone)
  4. After you complete configuration, MFA will be invoked each time you connect to an Microsoft 365 service from a new device.

**Troubleshooting**

If you have a smartphone, we recommend using the **Microsoft Authenticator App**. It makes using Microsoft 365 MFA quick and easy. Install it ahead of time from the:

  * [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-authenticator/id983156458?mt=8)
  * [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.azure.authenticator&hl=en_US)

Also, when you use your fingerprint to unlock the smartphone, you are truly using 3-factor authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Change your Microsoft 365 password to keep your account secure

**[Watch a video](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RWe8JR?pid=ocpVideo0-innerdiv-oneplayer&postJsllMsg=true&maskLevel=20&market=en-us) **about how to change your Microsoft 365 password or follow the instructions below.

If you still have troubles changing your password please contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com) below.

**Overview**

You may be expecting a message on your office phone while away from your desk for an extended period of time. You can access your voicemail from any phone remotely.

**Issue**

**In Office:**

  1. Dial **80**  or **5200** , then *****  and the four digit extension of the mailbox (e.g. *1234).
  2. Enter the passcode for the mailbox.
  3. Press **7**  to play messages.
  4. Press **3**  to delete messages.

**Remote:**

  1. Dial **604-323-5200  **and follow instructions.

**Troubleshooting**

Please ensure to use the correct dial in information from above to access your voicemail.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you are noticing that your PDF documents are automatically loading into your web browser you may be experiencing a limited number of feature.  A few options you will loose are: **Can 't sign a document, can't leave comments and can't open fillable PDF forms**. The solution is to change your default PDF reader to Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

**Issue**

First thing is to make sure of is that you already have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed on your computer. If you don't then by just installing it the issue will automatically be resolved.  If you need it installed on a corporate computer you will need to enter a Service Request Ticket.

To check if you have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed

  * Click the **Search**  icon beside the Start button
  * Type **Adobe**. If it's installed you will see it in the list.

There are a number of different ways to make this change but we will only look at one of them.

  * Click the **Search  **icon beside the start button again
  * Type **Default Apps**

  * Click**  Default Apps** to open it
  * Scroll down until you see **Set defaults by app  **and click it
  * You will now see a list of installed programs
    * **Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

  * Click **Manage**  on the next screen
  * You should now see a screen similar to this

  * More then likely your Default App for .pdf is your web browser (In this case mine is set to Microsoft Edge)
  * To make the change
    * Click **Microsoft Edge**
    * Then click **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

From now one, whenever you open a PDF document through a link, it will open in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC with all the functionality.

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues please make sure that Adobe is installed on your computer.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

There are a number of ways to report an issue in the Client Portal. When you request services through our Service Catalog, your request is automatically routed to the relevant team so we can get right to work.

**Issue**

  1. Navigate to the Client Portal at [https://solutions.teamdynamix.com](https://buffalony.teamdynamix.com/TDClient/1850/Portal/Home/)

**Overview**

If you receive a spam message you should send the message to [spam@teamdynamix.com](mailto:spam@access.ironport.com?subject=I%20would%20like%20to%20report%20spam%20or%20phishing%20to%20IT) as an attachment. Sending the message as an attached file is **crucial**  so necessary Internet headers are included. You must send the message from the inbox of the original recipient.

To report a phishing message, follow the procedure for reporting spam.

**Issue**

## What is spam?

Spam is unsolicited junk email sent indiscriminately in bulk, often for commercial purposes. Much of it is sent by botnets, networks of virus-infected computers, complicating the process of tracking down the spammers. According to various estimates, about 80% of all email in the world may be spam.

## What is phishing?

Phishing is the practice of defrauding users into giving up their usernames, passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal information. Phishing emails will often try to get you to click on links that take you to fake websites. They often pretend to be from organizations such as a bank, PayPal, Amazon, or even TeamDynamix.

Never respond to email asking you to provide personal information. TDX will never ask you for personal information by email.

## Steps on forwarding an email as an attachment for several popular email clients and web browsers

### Microsoft Outlook (Windows)

_Highlight the message_ , press Ctrl + Alt + F \--or-- _Highlight or Open  the message_, on the "Home" tab under the "More" option
of the "Respond" group choose Forward as attachment \--or-- _Open a new message,  _ drag and drop the message(s) to be forwarded into the
body of the new message.

###

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , drag and drop message(s) into the new message window

###

---

### Microsoft Outlook (Mac)

_Highlight the message_ , Control+Command+J  ( ^⌘J )

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _ on the **home ribbon  **click on **attachment**

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _on the **Message  **menu select **attachment**

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , **drag and drop  **message(s) into the **new message window**

### Mac OS X Mail

_Highlight message_ , select **Forward as Attachment  **from the menu

**Troubleshooting**

Further troubleshooting advice will be provided once the spam or phishing email is received.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

If you receive a spam message you should send the message to [spam@teamdynamix.com](mailto:spam@access.ironport.com?subject=I%20would%20like%20to%20report%20spam%20or%20phishing%20to%20IT) as an attachment. Sending the message as an attached file is **crucial**  so necessary Internet headers are included. You must send the message from the inbox of the original recipient.

To report a phishing message, follow the procedure for reporting spam.

**Issue**

## What is spam?

Spam is unsolicited junk email sent indiscriminately in bulk, often for commercial purposes. Much of it is sent by botnets, networks of virus-infected computers, complicating the process of tracking down the spammers. According to various estimates, about 80% of all email in the world may be spam.

## What is phishing?

Phishing is the practice of defrauding users into giving up their usernames, passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal information. Phishing emails will often try to get you to click on links that take you to fake websites. They often pretend to be from organizations such as a bank, PayPal, Amazon, or even TeamDynamix.

Never respond to email asking you to provide personal information. TDX will never ask you for personal information by email.

## Steps on forwarding an email as an attachment for several popular email clients and web browsers

### Microsoft Outlook (Windows)

_Highlight the message_ , press Ctrl + Alt + F \--or-- _Highlight or Open  the message_, on the "Home" tab under the "More" option
of the "Respond" group choose Forward as attachment \--or-- _Open a new message,  _ drag and drop the message(s) to be forwarded into the
body of the new message.

###

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , drag and drop message(s) into the new message window

###

---

### Microsoft Outlook (Mac)

_Highlight the message_ , Control+Command+J  ( ^⌘J )

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _ on the **home ribbon  **click on **attachment**

\--or--

_Highlight the message,  _on the **Message  **menu select **attachment**

### Office 365 Outlook Web Access - (OWA)

_Open a new message_ , **drag and drop  **message(s) into the **new message window**

### Mac OS X Mail

_Highlight message_ , select **Forward as Attachment  **from the menu

**Overview**

Remote access to the organizations network is available by connecting your device to Cisco's AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Service. Click on the appropriate link below for installation steps. Once installed, login with your userID and password.

NOTE: You must be granted permission to use remote VPN software. Please complete the [VPN Access Request Form](https://teamdynamix.com).

Check with your departmental technical support staff for assistance with setting up your computer so that it is configured correctly for remote access.

**Issue**

## Installation steps

If you have Java installed on your computer you will be prompted to manually download and install the Cisco AnyConnect VPN client. To ensure proper installation of the AnyConnect client, please uninstall any earlier Cisco VPN clients, restart your computer and then install the new client.

## Connection steps

  1. Launch the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client.
  2. Verify that **evpn2.sample.com**  is in the _**Connect to:**_  field.
  3. Click **Connect**
  4. Login with your User**ID  **and password and click **OK**.Disconnection steps
  5. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).

## Disconnection steps

  1. Click on the Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client icon (in the System Tray or Dock).
  2. Click **Disconnect**.

**Troubleshooting**

Be sure to uninstall earlier VPN version and reboot before installing Cisco AnyConnect client.

If you experience problems logging in after your VPN request has been approved, reset your userD password then try logging in to VPN again.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Up to now you only had a password to protect your account. If someone got hold of your password (an authentication factor), this person could use your username and password to impersonate you. If the system would request a second or third unique factor, taking over your account is a lot harder. There are 3 factors of authentication:

  1. Something you **know** : your password
  2. Something you **have** : your (smart)phone
  3. Something you **are** : your fingerprint

As you can see, with MFA just stealing your password will not be enough to take control of your account.

**Issue**

Microsoft 365 is currently using Two-Factor Authentication (2FA), relying on a password and a phone. In short it can be explained in the following steps:

  1. Your Office 365 account gets enabled for MFA
  2. Next time you logon to an Microsoft 365 account you need to configure MFA (this requires a web browser)
  3. You identify the methods of the second authentication. If you have an iPhone or Android we recommend the **Authenticator App**  (see screenshot of the app on an iPhone)
  4. After you complete configuration, MFA will be invoked each time you connect to an Microsoft 365 service from a new device.

**Troubleshooting**

If you have a smartphone, we recommend using the **Microsoft Authenticator App**. It makes using Microsoft 365 MFA quick and easy. Install it ahead of time from the:

  * [Apple App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/microsoft-authenticator/id983156458?mt=8)
  * [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.azure.authenticator&hl=en_US)

Also, when you use your fingerprint to unlock the smartphone, you are truly using 3-factor authentication.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**Overview**

Change your Microsoft 365 password to keep your account secure

**Issue**

**[Watch a video](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/videoplayer/embed/RWe8JR?pid=ocpVideo0-innerdiv-oneplayer&postJsllMsg=true&maskLevel=20&market=en-us) **about how to change your Microsoft 365 password or follow the instructions below.

### **Steps**

1\. Sign in to [office.com/signin](http://office.com/signin) with your work account.

2\. Go to Settings > Password.

3\. Enter your old password.

4\. Create a new password and confirm it.

5\. Select Submit to finish and change your password.

**Troubleshooting**

If you still have troubles changing your password please contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com) below.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).

**In Office:**

  1. Dial **80**  or **5200** , then *****  and the four digit extension of the mailbox (e.g. *1234).

**Overview**

If you are noticing that your PDF documents are automatically loading into your web browser you may be experiencing a limited number of feature.  A few options you will loose are: **Can 't sign a document, can't leave comments and can't open fillable PDF forms**. The solution is to change your default PDF reader to Adobe Acrobat Reader DC.

**Issue**

First thing is to make sure of is that you already have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed on your computer. If you don't then by just installing it the issue will automatically be resolved.  If you need it installed on a corporate computer you will need to enter a Service Request Ticket.

To check if you have Adobe Acrobat Reader DC installed

  * Click the **Search**  icon beside the Start button
  * Type **Adobe**. If it's installed you will see it in the list.

There are a number of different ways to make this change but we will only look at one of them.

  * Click the **Search  **icon beside the start button again
  * Type **Default Apps**

  * Click**  Default Apps** to open it
  * Scroll down until you see **Set defaults by app  **and click it
  * You will now see a list of installed programs
    * **Click Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

  * Click **Manage**  on the next screen
  * You should now see a screen similar to this

  * More then likely your Default App for .pdf is your web browser (In this case mine is set to Microsoft Edge)
  * To make the change
    * Click **Microsoft Edge**
    * Then click **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC**

From now one, whenever you open a PDF document through a link, it will open in Adobe Acrobat Reader DC with all the functionality.

**Troubleshooting**

If you continue to have issues please make sure that Adobe is installed on your computer.

**Additional Information**

Need additional information or assistance? Contact the [ITS Service Center](https://solutions.teamdynamix.com).
